Hey everyone,

I love the new quad-coupler, and I've been trying to develop a four-engine stage for an interplanetary probe I'm working on. The problem is that when I put decouplers on the set of engines, it adds those dang fairings. When I press the button to ignite the nukes, the fairings break off and and slam into the engine opposite them, everything goes boom, and I'm left with a giant pile of fuel tanks and no engines.

Anyone know how to avoid this? Is there a way to disable these fairings?

Thanks in advance! Cheers

Edited September 6, 2013 by tstehler1
This is indeed a pickle, My reccommendation, Radially mount the stages after it.
This one's come up a few times before. Use the Q and E keys to rotate your LV-Ns by 90 degrees or so. That should cause the fairings to eject safely away from the other engines.

Here's some image tutorials I made. I'm starting to get tired of repeating myself, suppose I should make a tutorial post in the tutorials section and just copy paste the link.
